Title: Analista de datos
Description:
Hi! üëãüèº

At Shakers, we're on the lookout for a Data & Analytics Specialist to take our Data team to the next level üöÄ




1. Team and Role

If you have experience working autonomously on technical data projects, thrive in a dynamic startup environment, and are ready to take your career to the next level, we want to hear from you.

This role offers the opportunity to enhance Shakers' analytics, with the chance to shape the next generation way of working. If you‚Äôre excited by the prospect of working in a fast-paced, innovative environment, collaborating with a talented team, and making a direct impact, this is the opportunity for you! ü§©




2. What you¬¥ll be doing

Your day-to-day in Data & Analytics

Writing efficient SQL queries for large-scale data warehouses.
Defining, building, and maintaining ETL models in our data warehouse using dbt and Airflow.
Building data integrations and ensuring data quality across pipeline layers.
Documenting and maintaining code and queries in GitLab.
Creating dashboards and reports in Looker/Looker Studio to communicate results and track KPIs.
Conducting exploratory analysis to shape projects and provide actionable recommendations.
Presenting insights to squad team members to guide business and product decisions.
Collaborating with PMs, designers, and engineers to define data needs, request app events, integrate third-party tools, and develop data models.
Supporting feature design with product managers and engineers through performance measurement and impact testing.
Developing organization-wide data sources to empower business teams in data exploration.
Working across teams to improve data practices and promote a data-driven culture.




3. What we¬¥re looking for

You¬¥re a great fit if you have...

Strong alignment with our principles‚Äîwe take this very seriously.
At least 1-2 years of experience as a Data Analyst.
Proficiency in writing and understanding complex SQL queries and handling large datasets.
Experience using Python for data science tasks (data cleaning, API calls, SQL calls, modeling).
Familiarity with data visualization tools like Tableau, Qlik, PowerBI, or Looker.
A graduate degree in Business Administration, Economics, Engineering, Statistics, or related fields.
Fluency in English and Spanish.

Bonus points:

A Master's degree or Bootcamp in Business Analytics, Business Intelligence, or related sciences.
Product Analytics experience with Amplitude, Datadog, Mixpanel, or similar.
Experience in Startup or fast paced environment




4. What's in it for you?

Compensation üí∞

The salary range for this position is between 35.000‚Ç¨ and 46.000‚Ç¨ OTE (on target earnings) gross annual salary.

The salary consists of:

Between 35.000‚Ç¨ & 40.000‚Ç¨ fixed salary
Up to 6.000‚Ç¨ quarterly bonus based on performance & potential (15%)

Why you¬¥ll love working at Shakers üíö

Be part of a rapidly growing, internationally expanding startup. üåç
Have an ambitious professional development plan to help you reach your full potential.
Enjoy an unbeatable team culture‚Äîask anyone on our team!
Take advantage of our hybrid ful flex methodology: a mix of remote and in-office work, with our office located in the heart of Madrid, Calle Vel√°zquez.
Perks include wellness programs, gym access, English classes, medical insurance, and more.

At the office... üìç

Organic fruit
Free caffeine and theine




5. Our recruitment process

As a startup, we are very agile and we like to see results quickly, which is why prioritize efficiency in our recruitment process.

Our goal is to have you onboard this March, so you can hit the ground running and make an impact from day one!

The Road to Joining Our Team

Round 1, Cultural Fit: Kick things off with an informal chat with our People & Culture team. Don‚Äôt worry‚Äîwe just want to get to know you better, learn about your goals, hobbies, and more!
Round 2, Case Study & Technical Skills with Product Team: Join two members of our Product team for a deep dive into a case study. This is your chance to showcase your client management skills and demonstrate how you approach problem-solving.
Round 3, Meet the Team: Have a conversation with additional team members to further explore your skillset and ensure there's a great cultural fit. This is also your chance to ask questions and see how we collaborate.
Final check, CEO Chat: Meet H√©ctor, our CEO! He‚Äôs excited to connect with you, talk about Shakers‚Äô future, and discuss your vision and expectations.




More about Shakers

At Shakers we imagine, design, and create the next-generation way of working.

Our vision is to be the leading community and platform in the world that helps companies work with freelance teams through our technology.

We are a 45-person, fast growing startup based in Madrid. It's the place for you if you're looking for a high-performance, very dynamic & technological environment surrounded by ambitious people!




Our DNA

At Shakers, we are obsessed with our values. Half of our bonuses are performance-based, and the other half come from embodying what it means to be a true Shaker!

WINNING TEAM üèÜ

We all feel like part of a winning team‚Äîone that pushes boundaries, challenges the status quo, and moves the needle! We set ambitious goals and seek people who are driven to achieve them.

F1C10 üí™üèº

We‚Äôre building an environment where fear doesn‚Äôt hold us back. Experimentation and learning from failure are part of our DNA. Fail fast, grow faster. Fail 1X, chase 10X. We value risk-takers who aren‚Äôt afraid to go big!

STAY HUMBLE ü§≤üèº

We embrace a beginner‚Äôs mindset‚Äîalways evolving, always learning, and always finding new solutions. At Shakers, humility combined with ambition fuels our success, and when we blend the two, the results are extraordinary!




A huge thanks for being interested in Shakers, we'd love to see you soon.

Title: Data Analyst I (They/She/He)
Description:
If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionize the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.

üí™ Our career development philosophy.

ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

Support the optimization of logistics features, with a focus on delivery areas and supply/demand imbalances, by maintaining and improving settings, quantifying their impact, providing data-driven insights, coordinating feature rollouts, and measuring their effectiveness.

THE JOURNEY


Work closely with local/regional stakeholders, product teams and development teams, serving as a bridge between product and operations, to define how to best set up and enable products, monitor and give visibility of metrics and KPIs.
Deep-dive on business metrics, in order to explore areas of opportunity and enable data-driven decision-making, based on applied statistics and probability techniques
Develop and maintain scalable and self-service visualization tools and storytelling dashboards.
Build optimization processes to define the best tuning of every feature on each geography.
Build robust relationships with stakeholders acting as a strategic and supportive link between the technology, business and product.
Support recurrent processes within the team, enabling the adjustment of tools to business needs
Continuously explore and refine key operational metrics (delivery time, efficiency, costs), gaining a comprehensive understanding of Glovo‚Äôs logistics.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


1-2 years of professional experience outside of an academic and internship setting, in a quantitative analysis role
Excellent SQL and Excel/GoogleSheet skills
Solid proficiency in statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown.
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, ...
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Great spoken and written English.


Individuals representing diverse profiles, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable


üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
üí≥ Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Since 2004 Fragrance Science has been developing and producing fragrances for their application in products for Home Care, Personal Care, Fine Perfumery, dealing with business partners in Spain and abroad. There are around 50.000 references of the fragrances in our database, with different product application, and we strive to constantly deliver a perfect service and fragrance expertise to our clients, adapting to their needs and expectations while working on different projects.




Job description

We are searching for a highly motivated team-player for the role of Data Analyst.




What will your responsibilities be?

Collect data from the company‚Äôs areas to be analyzed, structure it in a way that can be combined with the desired indicators, and hold meetings with department heads to understand how their data is structured and build dashboards that address the analytical needs.
Perform data analysis to generate reports for all company departments.
Experience with Power BI and SQL.




Requirements:

University degree in a related field (Data Analyst).
Excellent English skills.
Minimum of 2 years of experience.




What can we offer you?

Permanent contract.
Immediate start.
Salary based on experience and qualifications.
Stability and long-term opportunities.

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
Hi! üëãüèº

At Shakers, we're on the lookout for a Data & Analytics Specialist to take our Data team to the next level üöÄ




1. Team and Role

If you have experience working autonomously on technical data projects, thrive in a dynamic startup environment, and are ready to take your career to the next level, we want to hear from you.

This role offers the opportunity to enhance Shakers' analytics, with the chance to shape the next generation way of working. If you‚Äôre excited by the prospect of working in a fast-paced, innovative environment, collaborating with a talented team, and making a direct impact, this is the opportunity for you! ü§©




2. What you¬¥ll be doing

Your day-to-day in Data & Analytics

Writing efficient SQL queries for large-scale data warehouses.
Defining, building, and maintaining ETL models in our data warehouse using dbt and Airflow.
Building data integrations and ensuring data quality across pipeline layers.
Documenting and maintaining code and queries in GitLab.
Creating dashboards and reports in Looker/Looker Studio to communicate results and track KPIs.
Conducting exploratory analysis to shape projects and provide actionable recommendations.
Presenting insights to squad team members to guide business and product decisions.
Collaborating with PMs, designers, and engineers to define data needs, request app events, integrate third-party tools, and develop data models.
Supporting feature design with product managers and engineers through performance measurement and impact testing.
Developing organization-wide data sources to empower business teams in data exploration.
Working across teams to improve data practices and promote a data-driven culture.




3. What we¬¥re looking for

You¬¥re a great fit if you have...

Strong alignment with our principles‚Äîwe take this very seriously.
At least 1-2 years of experience as a Data Analyst.
Proficiency in writing and understanding complex SQL queries and handling large datasets.
Experience using Python for data science tasks (data cleaning, API calls, SQL calls, modeling).
Familiarity with data visualization tools like Tableau, Qlik, PowerBI, or Looker.
A graduate degree in Business Administration, Economics, Engineering, Statistics, or related fields.
Fluency in English and Spanish.

Bonus points:

A Master's degree or Bootcamp in Business Analytics, Business Intelligence, or related sciences.
Product Analytics experience with Amplitude, Datadog, Mixpanel, or similar.
Experience in Startup or fast paced environment




4. What's in it for you?

Compensation üí∞

The salary range for this position is between 35.000‚Ç¨ and 46.000‚Ç¨ OTE (on target earnings) gross annual salary.

The salary consists of:

Between 35.000‚Ç¨ & 40.000‚Ç¨ fixed salary
Up to 6.000‚Ç¨ quarterly bonus based on performance & potential (15%)

Why you¬¥ll love working at Shakers üíö

Be part of a rapidly growing, internationally expanding startup. üåç
Have an ambitious professional development plan to help you reach your full potential.
Enjoy an unbeatable team culture‚Äîask anyone on our team!
Take advantage of our hybrid ful flex methodology: a mix of remote and in-office work, with our office located in the heart of Madrid, Calle Vel√°zquez.
Perks include wellness programs, gym access, English classes, medical insurance, and more.

At the office... üìç

Organic fruit
Free caffeine and theine




5. Our recruitment process

As a startup, we are very agile and we like to see results quickly, which is why prioritize efficiency in our recruitment process.

Our goal is to have you onboard this March, so you can hit the ground running and make an impact from day one!

The Road to Joining Our Team

Round 1, Cultural Fit: Kick things off with an informal chat with our People & Culture team. Don‚Äôt worry‚Äîwe just want to get to know you better, learn about your goals, hobbies, and more!
Round 2, Case Study & Technical Skills with Product Team: Join two members of our Product team for a deep dive into a case study. This is your chance to showcase your client management skills and demonstrate how you approach problem-solving.
Round 3, Meet the Team: Have a conversation with additional team members to further explore your skillset and ensure there's a great cultural fit. This is also your chance to ask questions and see how we collaborate.
Final check, CEO Chat: Meet H√©ctor, our CEO! He‚Äôs excited to connect with you, talk about Shakers‚Äô future, and discuss your vision and expectations.




More about Shakers

At Shakers we imagine, design, and create the next-generation way of working.

Our vision is to be the leading community and platform in the world that helps companies work with freelance teams through our technology.

We are a 45-person, fast growing startup based in Madrid. It's the place for you if you're looking for a high-performance, very dynamic & technological environment surrounded by ambitious people!




Our DNA

At Shakers, we are obsessed with our values. Half of our bonuses are performance-based, and the other half come from embodying what it means to be a true Shaker!

WINNING TEAM üèÜ

We all feel like part of a winning team‚Äîone that pushes boundaries, challenges the status quo, and moves the needle! We set ambitious goals and seek people who are driven to achieve them.

F1C10 üí™üèº

We‚Äôre building an environment where fear doesn‚Äôt hold us back. Experimentation and learning from failure are part of our DNA. Fail fast, grow faster. Fail 1X, chase 10X. We value risk-takers who aren‚Äôt afraid to go big!

STAY HUMBLE ü§≤üèº

We embrace a beginner‚Äôs mindset‚Äîalways evolving, always learning, and always finding new solutions. At Shakers, humility combined with ambition fuels our success, and when we blend the two, the results are extraordinary!




A huge thanks for being interested in Shakers, we'd love to see you soon.

Title: Business Data Analyst
HTML:
Are we the best-kept secret in M√°laga?

We like to think so. Over the past year, our M√°laga hub has grown into a thriving center of excellence, where we combine innovation, collaboration, and opportunity. We are serious about finding the right people and are confident that we have a lot to offer.


The role in a nutshell

Are you passionate about leveraging data to make meaningful business improvements? As a Business Data Analyst within the Coupa Global Reporting & Governance team, you will be instrumental in enabling datadriven decision-making and fostering continuous improvement. Your goal? To turn data insights into actionable strategies that enhance contract compliance, boost supplier performance, and streamline operational efficiency. In this role, you will collaborate closely with diverse stakeholders, acting as a vital link between business needs and technical capabilities. Your responsibilities will include gathering and validating business requirements, translating them into technical specifications, and ensuring user-friendly reporting solutions meet organizational goals. You will uphold best practices in data quality, work towards impactful reporting outcomes, and create a data-driven culture across our global Coupa landscape. With opportunities for growth in a stimulating and innovative environment, you will develop cost-saving initiatives, enhance business processes, and maintain compliance with audit requirements. If you thrive on advancing improvements through data and working in a collaborative global team, this role is your next career move!


More specifically, you will be expected to:

‚Ä¢ Analyze trends and patterns in Power BI reports to identify areas for improvement, such as contract compliance and supplier performance;

‚Ä¢ Monitor catalogue growth and drive initiatives to increase on-catalogue purchasing and reduce offcatalogue spend;

‚Ä¢ Evaluate purchasing trends to enhance contract compliance and support cost-saving strategies;

‚Ä¢ Track payment schedules to maximize early payment discounts and optimize cost efficiency;

‚Ä¢ Implement initiatives to reduce cycle times for requisitions, invoice processing, and supplier onboarding;

‚Ä¢ Advocate for electronic invoicing to improve accuracy and streamline processes;

‚Ä¢ Gather, validate, and document business requirements for reporting projects;

‚Ä¢ Support data standardization efforts to enhance reporting accuracy and consistency;

‚Ä¢ Act as a liaison between business stakeholders and technical teams to ensure reporting solutions align with strategic goals;

‚Ä¢ Develop training programs and user guides to empower end users in utilizing reports effectively


Do you have what it takes?

‚Ä¢ Skilled at interpreting data and providing actionable business insights;

‚Ä¢ Advanced skills in Power BI and Excel; SAP experience is beneficial.

‚Ä¢ Solid interpersonal and communication skills to engage with and collaborate efficiently across teams;

‚Ä¢ High accuracy and a focus on maintaining data quality in reporting outputs;

‚Ä¢ Quick to identify and address operational and technical issues;

‚Ä¢ Significant experience in increasing efficiencies and optimizing workflows;

‚Ä¢ Experience working across procurement, finance, or accounts payable functions;

‚Ä¢ Ability to develop and deliver clear training materials for diverse user groups.


Language : As you will be part of a global team, you are expected to communicate fluently in English (verbal and written). Knowledge of other languages such as French, German, or Spanish is favorable but not mandatory.


Travel: Some occasional travelling will be required.


Location: This role will ideally be based at our Malaga office, but we could consider other suitable locations


Wondering what‚Äôs in it for you?

üÜô Be part of a world class organization with a mandate to identify opportunities for improvement and drive performance benefits

üè† Hybrid Work

üí∞ Competitive compensation structure

üë®‚Äçüë©‚Äçüëß‚Äçüë¶ Health Insurance coverage for you and your dependents

üõü Life Insurance

üìà Growth Opportunities (career progression, tuition assistance, language courses, training and certifications, etc.)

üõ¨ Relocation assistance


If you are ready to join our diverse team, make a difference and advance your career in a global setting, we want to hear from you.

Join us and help shape the future of data-driven procurement and finance processes! Given the global nature of the role, we ask applicants to submit their resume in English and indicate their working rights status.

Glencore encourages diversity and provides an inclusive workplace.

Accommodations are available upon request for applicants with special needs.

Interviews may start prior to the closing date.

Title: Data Analyst con Tableau
Description:
Kiteris es una empresa joven y √°gil dedicada a brindar servicios de gesti√≥n de servicios y proyectos TI de integraci√≥n de software, basados en la entrega de excelencia, la calidad de nuestro equipo y la aportaci√≥n de valor a trav√©s de la especializaci√≥n y la innovaci√≥n. Adem√°s, deber√°s crear reportes y visualizaciones que faciliten la interacci√≥n con los equipos implicados, comunicando eficazmente sus hallazgos a los encargados de tomar decisiones. Es esencial comprender e interpretar las necesidades del cliente interno, identificar oportunidades y riesgos a trav√©s del an√°lisis de datos, y promover mejoras en los resultados y desempe√±o de los equipos de negocio.




Tus funciones:

Liderar la elaboraci√≥n de informes y/o entregables relacionados con datos relevantes para la toma de decisiones, as√≠ como su presentaci√≥n ante los equipos de negocio.
Apoyar el desarrollo del equipo de Business Insights, brindando asistencia t√©cnica y promoviendo la comprensi√≥n del uso efectivo de los datos y las mejores pr√°cticas.
Generar visualizaciones e interpretaciones de datos efectivas (dise√±o de sistemas, tableros de control, gr√°ficos informativos, mapas, herramientas de datos y BI).
Actuar como punto focal en las reuniones con las √°reas de negocio para mostrar resultados y progresos, siendo capaz de priorizar y planificar proyectos bajo su gesti√≥n.
Llevar a cabo investigaciones cualitativas y cuantitativas, utilizando enfoques de m√©todos mixtos para el an√°lisis de datos seg√∫n las necesidades del negocio.




¬øQu√© perfil buscamos?

Formaci√≥n superior en √°reas como negocios, matem√°ticas, econom√≠a, finanzas, estad√≠stica o ingenier√≠a. Se valorar√°n estudios de M√°ster/MBA.
Experiencia en sectores como la aviaci√≥n, turismo y viajes ser√° valorada positivamente.
Alta capacidad anal√≠tica y destreza en modelos de datos: s√≥lida experiencia en SQL, con conocimientos de Python (deseable) y manejo de Big Data.
Buenas habilidades de comunicaci√≥n e influencia para interactuar con diversas √°reas y partes interesadas.
Pensamiento cr√≠tico y habilidades para resolver problemas: capacidad de comprender un problema, concebir una soluci√≥n y estructurarla.
Habilidad para estructurar informaci√≥n, analizarla y extraer datos seg√∫n las necesidades del negocio. Se valorar√° la experiencia en herramientas de visualizaci√≥n como Tableau, Power BI u otras similares.
Adaptabilidad ante la ambig√ºedad y capacidad de desafiar lo establecido.
Competencias profesionales como orientaci√≥n a resultados, trabajo colaborativo e iniciativa para la innovaci√≥n en la resoluci√≥n de problemas.
Experiencia y solidez en lenguajes de consulta de datos (por ejemplo, SQL) o software estad√≠stico/matem√°tico (por ejemplo, R, Python).
Espa√±ol e ingl√©s avanzado.




¬øQu√© ofrecemos?

Trabajo h√≠brido (4 d√≠as en remoto, 1 presencial).

Horario intensivo meses de Julio y Agosto.

Title: Data & Analytics Trainee
Description:
Job Summary

As a Data and Analytics Trainee, you will embark on a journey to dive deep into the world of data science and analytics. This role is designed for individuals who are passionate about leveraging data to drive insights and make informed decisions. You will be part of a dynamic team of data professionals, working closely with experienced data analysts, BI analysts and data engineers to hone your skills and contribute to real-world projects.




Key Accountabilities

Among others, you will:

Analytical Support

‚Ä¢Assist in data collection, cleaning, and preprocessing tasks under the guidance of senior team members.

‚Ä¢Learn to navigate and manipulate data using programming languages such as Python or SQL.

‚Ä¢Follow established protocols to ensure data quality and integrity throughout the process.

‚Ä¢Contribute to basic data analysis tasks, such as descriptive statistics, exploratory data analysis, and hypothesis testing.




Visualization and Reporting:

‚Ä¢Assist in creating visualizations and dashboards to communicate data findings effectively.

‚Ä¢Learn to use data visualization tools and libraries to create clear and compelling presentations of analytical results.




Minimum Knowledge & Experience required for the position:

We expect that you have experience with:

Knowledge of programming languages commonly used in data analysis, such as Python or SQL.
Ability to write and understand basic scripts or queries for data manipulation and analysis.
Familiarity with data visualization principles and techniques.
Knowledge of visualization tools like Power BI or QlikSense.
Clear and effective communication skills, both verbal and written in English (as a multinational company, English will be the primary language of communication in the meetings).

‚Ä¢Assist in data collection, cleaning, and preprocessing tasks under the guidance of senior team members.

‚Ä¢Learn to navigate and manipulate data using programming languages such as Python or SQL.

‚Ä¢Follow established protocols to ensure data quality and integrity throughout the process.

‚Ä¢Contribute to basic data analysis tasks, such as descriptive statistics, exploratory data analysis, and hypothesis testing.


  • Visualization and Reporting:

‚Ä¢Assist in creating visualizations and dashboards to communicate data findings effectively.

‚Ä¢Learn to use data visualization tools and libraries to create clear and compelling presentations of analytical results.


Minimum Knowledge & Experience required for the position:

We expect that you have experience with:

  • Knowledge of programming languages commonly used in data analysis, such as Python or SQL.
  • Ability to write and understand basic scripts or queries for data manipulation and analysis.
  • Familiarity with data visualization principles and techniques.
  • Knowledge of visualization tools like Power BI or QlikSense.
  • Clear and effective communication skills, both verbal and written in English (as a multinational company, English will be the primary language of communication in the meetings).

Title: Data Analyst I (They/She/He)
Description:
If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionize the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.

üí™ Our career development philosophy.

ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

Support the optimization of logistics features, with a focus on delivery areas and supply/demand imbalances, by maintaining and improving settings, quantifying their impact, providing data-driven insights, coordinating feature rollouts, and measuring their effectiveness.

THE JOURNEY


Work closely with local/regional stakeholders, product teams and development teams, serving as a bridge between product and operations, to define how to best set up and enable products, monitor and give visibility of metrics and KPIs.
Deep-dive on business metrics, in order to explore areas of opportunity and enable data-driven decision-making, based on applied statistics and probability techniques
Develop and maintain scalable and self-service visualization tools and storytelling dashboards.
Build optimization processes to define the best tuning of every feature on each geography.
Build robust relationships with stakeholders acting as a strategic and supportive link between the technology, business and product.
Support recurrent processes within the team, enabling the adjustment of tools to business needs
Continuously explore and refine key operational metrics (delivery time, efficiency, costs), gaining a comprehensive understanding of Glovo‚Äôs logistics.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


1-2 years of professional experience outside of an academic and internship setting, in a quantitative analysis role
Excellent SQL and Excel/GoogleSheet skills
Solid proficiency in statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown.
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, ...
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Great spoken and written English.


Individuals representing diverse profiles, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable


üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
üí≥ Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
Desde DOSS2 Talent estamos buscando una posici√≥n de ANALISTA DE DATOS para una empresa internacional del sector ferroviario con sede en Valencia, con m√°s de 80 a√±os de experiencia y m√°s de 3000 empleados.




MISI√ìN

Ser√° la persona encarga de recopilar toda la informaci√≥n de la organizaci√≥n con el objetivo de proporcionar insights, informes y recomendaciones que ayuden a la compa√±√≠a a tomar decisiones estrat√©gicas con el objetivo de optimizar sus operaciones, aumentar su eficiencia y competitividad, y responder de manera m√°s efectiva a las demandas del mercado y de los clientes.




Para ello,

Recolecta datos de diversas fuentes de la compa√±√≠a (bases de datos, archivos, ERP‚Ä¶). Prepara los datos eliminando errores, valores at√≠picos, datos duplicados o incompletos con el objetivo de asegurar que los datos sean precisos y concreto.
Modela los datos creando categor√≠as, estructuras y formas de relacionarlos.
Analiza los datos a partir de t√©cnicas estad√≠sticas, y herramientas de an√°lisis de datos con el objetivo de identificar patrones y tendencias.
Define dashboards para visualizaci√≥n de datos en distintas aplicaciones y plataformas.
Prepara informes que resuman los hallazgos y recomendaciones para la compa√±√≠a. Esto se acompa√±a de propuestas e hip√≥tesis con el objetivo de mejorar determinadas m√©tricas empresariales.
Desarrolla scripts o procesos automatizados para facilitar la recopilaci√≥n, limpieza y an√°lisis de datos, lo que puede ahorrar tiempo y reducir el riesgo de errores.
Establece sistemas de seguimiento para evaluar el impacto de las decisiones tomadas y realiza ajustes seg√∫n sea necesarios.
Asegura que la recopilaci√≥n y el uso de datos se realice de manera √©tica y cumplan con las regulaciones de privacidad de datos aplicables.







Requisitos de la vacante:

Educaci√≥n: Grado en Inform√°tica, Ingenier√≠a de Software, Ciencias de datos o similar
Experiencia previa: Al menos 3 a√±os de experiencia como Analista de Datos. Se requiere experiencia demostrable con Java, SQL y/o Phyton y experiencia en el manejo y consulta de bases de datos.
Idiomas: Ingl√©s Nivel equivalente B2 o superior. Se valorar√° positivamente otros idiomas.
Competencias: Experiencia con el dise√±o de proyectos que requieran operaciones complejas con datos procedentes de distintas fuentes.

Title: Data Analyst (Full remote within Spain)
Description:
We are seeking a skilled and experienced Data Analyst who is passionate about their work, adapts easily, and shares our company values!¬†

The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of working on multiple deliverables in parallel, and be comfortable receiving reporting requirements and translating these into solutions. In addition to, prioritizing and communicating progress and blockers effectively.¬†


Key Responsibilities:

Investigate, prioritise, and document anomalies
Use Excels skills to accomplish tasks of more complex nature (vlookups, pivot tables, IF conditions..)
Ensure data accuracy
Improve operations/processes for the team by identifying trends
Implement consumer data acquisition, e-commerce analytics and trigger-based marketing
Implement consumer analytics, consumer segmentation and profiling
Respond to data analysis requests from stakeholders and staff members
Retrieving data, cleaning and preparing data for analysis, performing data analysis, and uploading the information to various sources
Help with Daily, Weekly, Monthly & Annual reporting
Perform analysis on large data sets using appropriate data analysis techniques and tools with a strong focus on quality.
Defining the data quality standards in the context of the specific initiatives.
Maintain functional expertise in database analytics best practices and the tools that support them.
Work with cross-functional teams such as engineering, product management, business intelligence to deploy data quality across critical pipelines and to set up processes to triage data issues
Create and optimise metrics and reporting functions to measure and monitor data quality for our most critical data assets
Effectively and timely communicate data quality insights and drive projects to improve data quality
Research data sources and make any corrections to existing data as needed to ensure accuracy of the information being recorded.
Real time data analyst, monitoring and identifying performance drops using analytics tools to ensure timely resolution and maintain optimal product functionality.¬†
Reviewing data control alerts, ensuring that processes operate effectively and efficiently, enabling proactive identification and resolution of data issues.



Requirements



What will make you stand out from the crowd:

BA/BS in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, Business or analytical field.¬†
Excellent judgement, critical-thinking, and decision-making skills
Extremely detailed oriented
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Strong analytical problem solving skill
Advanced Expertise in MS Excel and Google sheet required
Preferred knowledge/experience with Analytics Platform and SQL
Knowledge of Amplitude is nice to have., ideally with experience in international environments.
Good knowledge of Amplitude is nice to have.



Benefits



Perks of being one of us:

Top-notch private health insurance ‚Äî includes dental and psychological services
Full-time, permanent contract
Flexible time off, no blackout dates, plus your birthday, Christmas' Eve and New Year's Eve off¬†
Remote work OR come into the office if you prefer!¬†
Flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. / 3:30 - 7:30 p.m)
Free Friday afternoons (a 7-hour workday!) + 35-hour week in July and August (free afternoons here we come!)
Enhanced career path designed just for you
External training budget¬†
Other: ticket restaurant, nursery tickets
Budget for team-building activities¬†
We celebrate all company landmarks
And when you come into the office, you'll get free coffee and snacks, fresh fruit, and can enjoy our game room and the cool terrace overlooking the Mediterranean




Sounds good? Apply now!


We're looking forward to getting to know you :)



Equal Employment Opportunity Employer

Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be part of a great project!

Location

You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you.

If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona's Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you'll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions.

The personal data you provide will be used to manage your candidacy for the corporate selection processes that fit your profile. If you wish, you can exercise your rights of access, rectification or cancellation by sending a letter to Avenida Litoral, 12-14, 5ta planta, Barcelona 08005, or emailing us at protecciondedatos@LeadTech.com, including a document that validates your identity.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are BOB, a hybrid L2 to build and launch Bitcoin applications. Our mission is accelerating the world's transition to a fair and transparent financial system through Bitcoin as a credibly neutral, global settlement asset. We believe in a world with access to finance for everyone, everywhere, in a secure and usable manner.

As a Data Analyst for BOB, you will be leading the quantitative insights to grow and direct decisions at BOB. You are the main person responsible for analysing various on- and off-chain data sources to create and track KPIs and identify trends with a deep product understanding. You will work closely with the product, business, and marketing teams to formulate hypothesis and deliver actionable recommendations focussing on DeFi on BOB.

What You Will Do


Product Metrics and Reporting: Track, analyse, and report on key performance metrics, including channel performance, user activation and retention, TVL, trading volume, and other KPIs
Market Research: Conduct in-depth market analysis to identify emerging trends within the Bitcoin and DeFi ecosystem
Identify DeFi Opportunities: Regularly prepare and update reports about investment opportunities on BOB for our institutional partners
Data Infrastructure: Together with the engineering team, design and build foundational data systems, including ETLs, dashboards, and analytics that drive data-driven decision-making and support scalable business growth



Requirements


Proven ability to lead complex analytical projects from concept to completion, especially in web3 environments
Advanced proficiency in SQL and Python through your experience as business or data analyst or other quant-related position
Deep understanding of DeFi, including protocols, block explorers, and data sources
Eagerness to improve products through fast experimentation, A/B testing, and a data-driven approach
Enjoy working in a results-driven and fast-paced startup environment



Benefits


Research-oriented team
Solve novel problems
Stock options
Remote working
30-day vacation
Allowance for a co-working space
Yearly retreat
Show more

Description:
Somos Banco Sabadell




Banco Sabadell es una de las principales entidades bancarias en Espa√±a con m√°s de 14.000 personas caracterizadas por nuestra implicaci√≥n, esp√≠ritu de colaboraci√≥n y dinamismo. Banco Sabadell ofrece sus servicios a m√°s de 11 millones de clientes contando con una posici√≥n privilegiada en el segmento de empresas.

Y adem√°s, lo hacemos mediante una gesti√≥n responsable y comprometida con el medio ambiente.




¬°√önete a nosotros!




¬øQu√© estamos buscando?




Actualmente buscamos un perfil proactivo y con iniciativa, que tenga curiosidad y clara orientaci√≥n a la resoluci√≥n de problemas, con capacidad anal√≠tica y de auto-organizaci√≥n y que sepa trabajar en equipo.




Hablemos del proyecto‚Ä¶




Los modelos de riesgos evolucionan cada d√≠a gracias al aumento en la disponibilidad y capacidad de an√°lisis de datos, permitiendo el desarrollo de nuevas herramientas cuantitativas √∫tiles para la gesti√≥n y toma de decisiones. Esto, junto con las m√∫ltiples exigencias regulatorias sobre el sector bancario, hace que exista una amplia variedad de tareas que requieren un alto grado de implicaci√≥n por su complejidad.




La Direcci√≥n de Modelos de Riesgo tiene como misi√≥n dar soporte a las diversas √°reas encargadas de la modelizaci√≥n del riesgo de cr√©dito en Banco Sabadell participando transversalmente de forma activa en los diversos procesos dentro del ciclo de vida de un modelo (an√°lisis de datos, modelizaci√≥n, validaci√≥n, implantaci√≥n y seguimiento), principalmente en la construcci√≥n de las herramientas de calificaci√≥n (rating/scoring) y en la estimaci√≥n de los par√°metros de riesgo (PD, LGD y EAD) para el c√°lculo de capital y provisiones del Grupo Banco Sabadell.




Entre tus responsabilidades principales se encontrar√°n:




Participar√°s en el desarrollo metodol√≥gico de los modelos internos del Grupo Banco Sabadell:




Desarrollo de los modelos de calificaci√≥n crediticia tipo rating/scoring, valorando el potencial riesgo del Banco a trav√©s del an√°lisis de datos y la construcci√≥n de modelos predictivos que permitan explicar el perfil y la capacidad de pago de las empresas y personas f√≠sicas.
Estimaci√≥n y backtest de los modelos internos de PD (Probability of Default), EAD (Exposure At Default), LGD (Loss Given Default) y otros par√°metros para provisiones (IFRS9), para capital regulatorio (IRB) y para planificaci√≥n financiera (Stress Test, ICAAP).
Desarrollo, aplicaci√≥n y seguimiento una vez implementados.
Assessment de compliance con est√°ndares de Banco Sabadell y los requerimientos regulatorios.
Documentaci√≥n modelos y estimaciones para uso en Banco Sabadell.




Dar√°s soporte en auditor√≠as y validaciones tanto internas como externas (supervisor, auditores externos).




Har√°s mantenimiento y desarrollo de las BBDD:




Controles de calidad de datos y conocimiento del proceso.
Planteo de requerimientos a IT y validaci√≥n de la implementaci√≥n de los mismos.




¬øQu√© valoramos de tu candidatura?




Que tengas estudios superiores en Econom√≠a, Estad√≠stica, Matem√°ticas, Actuariales, F√≠sica o Ingenier√≠a Superior.




Valoraremos formaci√≥n complementaria (Master o Postgrado) con componente cuantitativo y/o acreditaciones como FRM, CQF, Certificaciones en Data Analytics, Modelling, Machine Learning o similar.




Experiencia m√≠nima de 1-2 a√±os en funciones vinculadas a modelos de riesgo de cr√©dito (desarrollo, control, seguimiento, coordinaci√≥n, validaci√≥n, auditor√≠a), en sector Banca.




Que est√©s habituado y/o aportes experiencia en gesti√≥n de informaci√≥n, an√°lisis de BBDD y elaboraci√≥n de informes, con conocimiento del entorno regulatorio y normativa aplicable a riesgo de cr√©dito.




Que conozcas con suficiencia lenguajes de programaci√≥n estad√≠stica (SAS - SQL), as√≠ como dominio del paquete Office. Valoraremos conocimientos de otros lenguajes de programaci√≥n (Phyton, R) y herramientas de BI (Power BI).




Que aportes un buen nivel de Ingl√©s (m√≠nimo B2).







Banco Sabadell est√° comprometido en promover ambientes de trabajo en los que se trate con respeto y dignidad a las personas, procurando el desarrollo profesional de la plantilla y garantizando la igualdad de oportunidades en su selecci√≥n, formaci√≥n y promoci√≥n ofreciendo un entorno de trabajo libre de cualquier discriminaci√≥n por motivo de g√©nero, edad, orientaci√≥n sexual, religi√≥n, etnia o cualquier otra circunstancia personal o social.

Title: Data & Analytics Specialist
Description:
Hi! üëãüèº

At Shakers, we're on the lookout for a Data & Analytics Specialist¬†to take our Data team to the next level üöÄ

1. Team and Role

If you have experience working¬†autonomously on technical data projects, thrive in a dynamic startup environment, and are ready to take your career to the next level, we want to hear from you.

This role offers the opportunity to enhance Shakers' analytics, with the chance to shape the next generation way of working. If you‚Äôre excited by the prospect of working in a fast-paced, innovative environment, collaborating with a talented team, and making a direct impact, this is the opportunity for you! ü§©


2. What you¬¥ll be doing

Your day-to-day in Data & Analytics

Writing efficient SQL queries for large-scale data warehouses.
Defining, building, and maintaining ETL models in our data warehouse using dbt and Airflow.
Building data integrations and ensuring data quality across pipeline layers.
Documenting and maintaining code and queries in GitLab.
Creating dashboards and reports in Looker/Looker Studio to communicate results and track KPIs.
Conducting exploratory analysis to shape projects and provide actionable recommendations.
Presenting insights to squad team members to guide business and product decisions.
Collaborating with PMs, designers, and engineers to define data needs, request app events, integrate third-party tools, and develop data models.
Supporting feature design with product managers and engineers through performance measurement and impact testing.
Developing organization-wide data sources to empower business teams in data exploration.
Working across teams to improve data practices and promote a data-driven culture.

3. What we¬¥re looking for

You¬¥re a great fit if you have...

Strong alignment with our principles‚Äîwe take this very seriously.
At least 1-2 years of experience as a Data Analyst.
Proficiency in writing and understanding complex SQL queries and handling large datasets.
Experience using Python for data science tasks (data cleaning, API calls, SQL calls, modeling).
Familiarity with data visualization tools like Tableau, Qlik, PowerBI, or Looker.
A graduate degree in Business Administration, Economics, Engineering, Statistics, or related fields.
Fluency in English and Spanish.

Bonus points:

A Master's degree or Bootcamp in Business Analytics, Business Intelligence, or related sciences.
Product Analytics¬†experience with Amplitude, Datadog, Mixpanel, or similar.
Experience in Startup or fast paced environment




4. What's in it for you?

Compensation üí∞

The salary range for this position is between 35.000‚Ç¨ and 46.000‚Ç¨ OTE (on target earnings) gross annual salary.

The salary consists of:

Between 35.000‚Ç¨ & 40.000‚Ç¨ fixed salary
Up to 6.000‚Ç¨ quarterly bonus based on performance & potential (15%)

Why you¬¥ll love working at Shakers üíö

Be part of a rapidly growing, internationally expanding startup. üåç
Have an ambitious professional development plan to help you reach your full potential.
Enjoy an unbeatable team culture‚Äîask anyone on our team!
Take advantage of our hybrid¬†ful flex methodology: a mix of remote and in-office work, with our office located in the heart of Madrid, Calle Vel√°zquez.
Perks include wellness programs, gym access, English classes, medical insurance, and more.

At the office... üìç

Organic fruit
Free caffeine and theine

5. Our recruitment process

As a startup, we are very agile and we like to see results quickly, which is why prioritize efficiency in our recruitment process.

Our goal is to have you onboard this March, so you can hit the ground running and make an impact from day one!


The Road to Joining Our Team


Round 1,¬†Cultural Fit:¬†Kick things off with an informal chat with our People & Culture team. Don‚Äôt worry‚Äîwe just want to get to know you better, learn about your goals, hobbies, and more!
Round 2,¬†Case Study & Technical Skills with Product Team:¬†Join two members of our Product¬†team for a deep dive into a case study. This is your chance to showcase your client management skills and demonstrate how you approach problem-solving.
Round 3,¬†Meet the Team:¬†Have a conversation with additional team members to further explore your skillset and ensure there's a great cultural fit. This is also your chance to ask questions and see how we collaborate.
Final check,¬†CEO Chat:¬†Meet H√©ctor, our CEO! He‚Äôs excited to connect with you, talk about Shakers‚Äô future, and discuss your vision and expectations.
More about Shakers

At Shakers we imagine, design, and create the next-generation way of working.

Our vision is to be the leading community and platform in the world that helps companies work with freelance teams through our technology.

We are a 45-person, fast growing startup based in Madrid. It's the place for you if you're looking for a high-performance, very dynamic & technological environment surrounded by ambitious people!



Our DNA

At Shakers, we are obsessed with our values. Half of our bonuses are performance-based, and the other half come from embodying what it means to be a true Shaker!

WINNING TEAM üèÜ

We all feel like part of a winning team‚Äîone that pushes boundaries, challenges the status quo, and moves the needle! We set ambitious goals and seek people who are driven to achieve them.

F1C10 üí™üèº

We‚Äôre building an environment where fear doesn‚Äôt hold us back. Experimentation and learning from failure are part of our DNA. Fail fast, grow faster. Fail 1X, chase 10X. We value risk-takers who aren‚Äôt afraid to go big!

STAY HUMBLE ü§≤üèº

We embrace a beginner‚Äôs mindset‚Äîalways evolving, always learning, and always finding new solutions. At Shakers, humility combined with ambition fuels our success, and when we blend the two, the results are extraordinary!




A huge thanks for being interested in Shakers, we'd love to see you soon.

    • Developing organization-wide data sources to empower business teams in data exploration.
    • Working across teams to improve data practices and promote a data-driven culture.

3. What we¬¥re looking for

You¬¥re a great fit if you have...

    • Strong alignment with our principles‚Äîwe take this very seriously.
    • At least 1-2 years of experience as a Data Analyst.
    • Proficiency in writing and understanding complex SQL queries and handling large datasets.
    • Experience using Python for data science tasks (data cleaning, API calls, SQL calls, modeling).
    • Familiarity with data visualization tools like Tableau, Qlik, PowerBI, or Looker.
    • A graduate degree in Business Administration, Economics, Engineering, Statistics, or related fields.
    • Fluency in English and Spanish.

Bonus points:

  • A Master's degree or Bootcamp in Business Analytics, Business Intelligence, or related sciences.
  • Product Analytics experience with Amplitude, Datadog, Mixpanel, or similar.
  • Experience in Startup or fast paced environment


4. What's in it for you?

Compensation üí∞

The salary range for this position is between 35.000‚Ç¨ and 46.000‚Ç¨ OTE (on target earnings) gross annual salary.

The salary consists of:

  • Between 35.000‚Ç¨ & 40.000‚Ç¨ fixed salary
  • Up to 6.000‚Ç¨ quarterly bonus based on performance & potential (15%)

Why you¬¥ll love working at Shakers üíö

  • Be part of a rapidly growing, internationally expanding startup. üåç
  • Have an ambitious professional development plan to help you reach your full potential.
  • Enjoy an unbeatable team culture‚Äîask anyone on our team!
  • Take advantage of our hybrid ful flex methodology: a mix of remote and in-office work, with our office located in the heart of Madrid, Calle Vel√°zquez.
  • Perks include wellness programs, gym access, English classes, medical insurance, and more.

At the office... üìç

  • Organic fruit
  • Free caffeine and theine
5. Our recruitment process

As a startup, we are very agile and we like to see results quickly, which is why prioritize efficiency in our recruitment process.

Our goal is to have you onboard this March, so you can hit the ground running and make an impact from day one!

The Road to Joining Our Team

  • Round 1, Cultural Fit: Kick things off with an informal chat with our People & Culture team. Don‚Äôt worry‚Äîwe just want to get to know you better, learn about your goals, hobbies, and more!
  • Round 2, Case Study & Technical Skills with Product Team: Join two members of our Product team for a deep dive into a case study. This is your chance to showcase your client management skills and demonstrate how you approach problem-solving.
  • Round 3, Meet the Team: Have a conversation with additional team members to further explore your skillset and ensure there's a great cultural fit. This is also your chance to ask questions and see how we collaborate.
  • Final check, CEO Chat: Meet H√©ctor, our CEO! He‚Äôs excited to connect with you, talk about Shakers‚Äô future, and discuss your vision and expectations.
More about Shakers

At Shakers we imagine, design, and create the next-generation way of working.

Our vision is to be the leading community and platform in the world that helps companies work with freelance teams through our technology.

We are a 45-person, fast growing startup based in Madrid. It's the place for you if you're looking for a high-performance, very dynamic & technological environment surrounded by ambitious people!

Our DNA

At Shakers, we are obsessed with our values. Half of our bonuses are performance-based, and the other half come from embodying what it means to be a true Shaker!

WINNING TEAM üèÜ

We all feel like part of a winning team‚Äîone that pushes boundaries, challenges the status quo, and moves the needle! We set ambitious goals and seek people who are driven to achieve them.

F1C10 üí™üèº

We‚Äôre building an environment where fear doesn‚Äôt hold us back. Experimentation and learning from failure are part of our DNA. Fail fast, grow faster. Fail 1X, chase 10X. We value risk-takers who aren‚Äôt afraid to go big!

STAY HUMBLE ü§≤üèº

We embrace a beginner‚Äôs mindset‚Äîalways evolving, always learning, and always finding new solutions. At Shakers, humility combined with ambition fuels our success, and when we blend the two, the results are extraordinary!


A huge thanks for being interested in Shakers, we'd love to see you soon.

Title: Data Analyst (Product)
Description:
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products ‚Äî including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more ‚Äî help our 50+ million customers get more from their money every day.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‚Äå 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work‚Ñ¢. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren‚Äôt kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They‚Äôre some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product Teams and deliver rock star solutions ü§ò

We‚Äôre looking for a superstar Data Analyst who does not believe there is a data task that can be too hard ü¶¨ From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process they never stop learning, picking up new skills and delivering value.

Up for the challenge? Get in touch üëá

What You‚Äôll Be Doing


Understanding our business and its processes through our data
Applying this understanding and knowledge of data to help product and service teams
Designing key metrics to measure different aspects of the business
Creating and maintaining new aggregated views and tables to simplify data querying
Maintaining and creating new dashboards to track metrics and visualise insights
Promoting data literacy across the company, organising and holding workshops


What You'll Need


Previous experience in an analytical role, creating impactful solutions
A strong background/education in a quantitative discipline
5+ years of experience with SQL
Great skills with Python or other programming languages
Evidence of strong mathematical and statistics knowledge


Building a global financial super app isn‚Äôt enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that‚Äôs why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We‚Äôre doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That‚Äôs why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Refer to our <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Data Privacy Statement for Candidates for details on our data handling practices during your application.

Title: BI Analsyt
Description:
Hi, we‚Äôre Fever

We‚Äôre excited you are checking out this job offer.

We are the leading global live-entertainment discovery tech platform with a clear mission: to democratize access to culture and entertainment.

How do we achieve our mission? Fever has developed a proprietary technology that inspires a global community of over 125M people through personalized and curated experiences in their local city whilst empowering entertainment and event creators to reach new audiences and enhance their experience.

Sounds amazing, right?

BILLING SPECIALIST:

Fever is looking for an Analyst that will play a vital role in taking our products to the next level, deepening/ widening our current understanding of our users and identifying improvement opportunities for our product. We're looking for someone with great analysis skills, the ability to get things done and a genuine interest on our customers.This is the perfect position for someone who knows a variety of techniques and tools related to data analysis (examples of techniques: SQL, clustering, predictive models, pattern recognition, examples of tools: Excel, R, Google Analytics, Mixpanel, etc) with Finance Background and loves digging into data to uncover product/business problems and opportunities.You will work closely with different areas of the business, mainly Finance and Business Development.We also value the ability to understand how to prioritize, think on how things will scale, make tradeoffs and balances the business needs with technical constraints .

Key responsibilities


Auditing of Invoices, payments and current reporting & analytics oriented to Finance & Billing
Auditing any changes to ensure data accuracy and normalization of data
Completing critical analysis that will drive growth and provide insights about payments, invoices and commissions
Develop, Maintain and enhance through automatization current control and working sheets
Generate queries and reports for better controls and operations


About you


Bachelor‚Äôs degree with Engineering/Finance/Auditing background required.
0-2 Years of relevant experience
Strong analytical and quantitative skills; strong bias towards data-based decision.
To love everything data - designing models, reporting, driving results/growth
Excellent written and spoken English
Ability to communicate clearly and effectively with developers, business owners, and senior business leaders.
High sense of ownership, urgency, and drive.


Preferred Qualifications


VBA, Python preferred; Strong Excel/Google Sheets knowledge required.
An excellent understanding of SQL or other query languages preferred
Experience in a cross-functional team.


Benefits and Perks


Have a real impact on the company's growth and evolution
Excellent working conditions with a location in the heart of the Madrid scene
Home-office friendly
Great work environment with a young, international team of talented people to work with
40% Discount on all events on Fever
Health insurance and other benefits such as Flexible remuneration with a 100% tax exemption through Cobee
English Lessons
Gympass Membership
We have free food, drink and fruit at the office!
Possibility to receive in advance part of your salary by Payflow


Thank you for considering joining Fever. We cannot wait to learn more about you!

If you want to learn more about us: Fever's Blog | Tech.Eu |TechCrunch

Fever is committed to creating an inclusive and diverse workspace where everyone's background and ideas count. Our main goal is to find the best possible talent regardless of place of birth, racial or ethnic origin, gender, gender identity, religion, opinion, sexual orientation, disability, pregnancy, marital status, age or caring responsibilities. We encourage everyone to apply!

If you require any kind of accommodation during the selection process please contact our Talent team so we can help you by providing a welcoming and seamless journey.

If you want to know more about how Fever processes your personal data, click here Fever - Candidate Privacy Notice

Title: Power BI Data Analyst
Description:
We are expanding our Big Data team and looking for a Junior Data Analyst with Power BI reporting skills to join us!




If you are a motivated professional with some experience using the Power BI reporting tool, basic data analysis skills and a solid understanding of SQL, Excel and Microsoft Power Automate tools, this is the perfect opportunity to grow your career!




What will you do?

Design and develop interactive Power BI reports.
Analyze data from multiple sources to generate actionable insights.
Create Power BI dashboards to transform the data we collect into useful information for various departments within the company.
Automate BI processes to enhance data accessibility and usability for different teams.




What we expect:

Experience with Power BI for reporting and visualization.
Familiarity with SQL, Excel and Microsoft Power Automate.
Strong problem-solving skills and eagerness to learn.
A minimum B2 level of English, both written and spoken, to collaborate effectively in an international environment.
Ability to work with different teams to ensure data is used effectively.




Social Benefits:

Flexible schedule.
Restaurant tickets.
Health insurance.
Annual performance bonus.
And much more!




Find us on our social networks and you will be able to see what our daily life at HP SCDS is like:

Instagram
Twitter
YouTube
Show more

Title: Middle Data Analyst
Description:
Volkswagen Group Services is excited to present a fantastic opportunity to join our Volkswagen Digital:Hub in Spain. As part of the global Software Development Centre network in the Volkswagen Group, we constantly seek talented individuals ready to bring their unique skills to our projects.

Our start-up environment is collaborative, innovative, and open to new ideas. We strive to cultivate a work culture that encourages individual growth, team empowerment, and project excellence. We value respect, teamwork, and the common purpose that binds us as a group. If you're ready to thrive in a dynamic start-up environment and be part of our family, supported by one of the largest companies in the world, we invite you to read further.

About the Team and the Hub:


Our culture is centered around fostering individual growth and team empowerment within a flexible and supportive environment.
We prioritize respect, teamwork, and inclusivity, recognizing and valuing the unique contributions of each member.
We embrace a work-life balance philosophy and encourage continuous personal and professional development.


The Role:


We are looking for a Data Analyst who excels at using Tableau and other data visualization tools to turn complex datasets into clear, actionable insights. In this role, you will be responsible for building efficient data models, optimizing performance, and creating engaging dashboards. While familiarity with QlikView is a plus (our legacy system is built on QlikView), it is not a strict requirement.


Key Responsibilities:


Data Visualization & Reporting:
Develop and maintain interactive dashboards primarily in Tableau.
Translate data findings into visually appealing presentations and reports for stakeholders.
Data Modeling & Optimization:
Design, build, and maintain effective data models.
Implement optimization techniques to ensure data accuracy and performance.
Collaborate with data engineering teams to maintain data quality across databases.
Analysis & Insights:
Conduct exploratory data analysis to identify trends, correlations, and actionable insights.
Provide regular and ad-hoc reports to support business decisions and strategies.
Recommend improvements based on data findings and business needs.
Collaboration & Stakeholder Engagement:
Partner with product, marketing, and operations teams to understand data requirements.
Offer recommendations on best practices in data usage and interpretation.
Communicate complex analytical concepts to non-technical audiences.


Requirements:


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field.
2+ years of experience in a Data Analyst or similar analytical role.
Fluent in Spanish and English
Technical Skills:
Proficiency in Tableau (development, deployment, troubleshooting).
Experience with SQL and relational databases for data extraction and manipulation.
Understanding of data modeling concepts, ETL processes, and data warehousing principles.
Knowledge of performance tuning and optimization best practices.
Experience with other BI tools such as QlikView (legacy environment) is a plus, but not required.
Soft Skills:
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills.
Excellent verbal and written communication abilities.
Attention to detail and commitment to data integrity.
Ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional environment.


What we offer:


Hybrid work, with an option to work from home some days per week.
Access to professional development tools and free language courses.
Flexible working hours to accommodate personal and professional needs.
A competitive holiday package and access to a variety of employee discounts.


Join us at Volkswagen Digital:Hub to advance your career in a role where your administrative skills will directly contribute to the success and smooth operation of our innovative projects.

For more information on our data processing activities and your rights as a data subject, please consult our privacy policy.

Ref: Level C

Title: Marketing Data Analyst (Remote)
Description:
We're looking for a Marketing Data Analyst who is passionate about their work, adapts easily, and shares our company values!


A little bit about us

Leadtech has been fostering and developing innovative digital businesses across several industries since 2009. It has since then expanded to a team of over 500 committed employees working all over Spain. We are thrilled to have more than 23 nationalities working together and very proud to see that our products and services are enjoyed by millions of users monthly around the globe.


How you will make a difference:


Measure the performance of marketing campaigns, build ad hoc custom reports, and analyze anomalies and trends.
Preparation of analytical reports and dashboards (including visualization) for the marketing team.
Creation of Google Sheets scripts to connect data from different reports and Google Sheets.
High experience and skill level in Microsoft Excel / Google Sheets.
Analysis of product & marketing metrics correlation and identification of their drivers.
Analysis and identification of user behavior patterns based on product & marketing analytics and forming hypotheses for the marketing team based on these insights
Develop the SKAN measurement approach for Google, Meta and Tiktok.
Deeply understand the process of acquisition of users in order to analyze/provide valuable proposals
Manage MMP Tools (Adjust), and provide technical support and troubleshooting for the marketing team, specifically related to app attribution, event tracking, and callback implementations.
Analyze performance impact of any product and marketing strategy changes.
Cooperate with Marketing and Product teams to actively increase project profitability¬†
Collaborate with the BI department to create and maintain data visualization dashboards.




Requirements


Bachelor degree in STEM field or similar
Experience working as Analyst of at least 3 years
Strong knowledge of app attribution tools commonly used in the mobile advertising industry.
Strong knowledge of machine learning and statistics techniques.
Strong communication skills and the ability to translate technical findings into clear business recommendations.
In-depth understanding of digital marketing strategies including down funnel analysis, as well technical knowledge of iOS and Android marketing analysis to tailor strategies for both platforms.
Experience working with data visualization tools
Experience with setting up and managing event tracking in mobile apps. Especially with a focus on SKAN, Firebase, Meta etc.
Teamwork and collaboration skills to work closely with other data professionals and cross-functional teams.
Proactive attitude and results-oriented.



Benefits



Perks of being one of us


Full-time, permanent contract
Flexible time off, no blackout dates, plus your birthday, Christmas' Eve and New Year's Eve off
Remote work
Flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. / 3:30 - 7:30 p.m)
Free Friday afternoons (a 7-hour workday!) + 35-hour week in July and August (free afternoons here we come!)
Enhanced career path designed just for you
External training budget
We celebrate all company landmarks



Sounds good? Apply now! We're looking forward to getting to know you.


Equal Employment Opportunity Employer

Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expressi√≥n and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be a part of a great project!

Location

You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you.

If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona's Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you'll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions.

Show more
